alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Mainland Hyde (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 15 at 4:29AM EST until January 17 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...1 to 3 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along the Pamlico and Pungo Rivers and adjacent tidal creeks, and areas along the Pamlico Sound, Pungo and lower Pamlico Rivers. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be alert for rapid water level rises as the winds shift to the southeast and increase quickly on Sunday afternoon.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. A Coastal Flood Watch means that conditions favorable for flooding are expected to develop. Coastal residents should be alert for later statements or warnings, and take action to protect property.
